title: Our Future Vision
description: Explore how you envision your future together and align on shared dreams.

questions.text: When I think about our future together, I feel...
choices: Grateful we're on this journey together

therapeutic.rationale: Feelings about the future reveal attachment security and optimism. Excitement shows anticipation; security shows groundedness; curiosity shows openness; gratitude shows appreciation. Sharing these feelings deepens connection around your shared future.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different feelings about the future are all positive orientations. The excited and the grounded can balance each other.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared feelings about the future create emotional alignment around your shared journey.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you feel when you think about your future together? Have you shared this with your partner?

questions.text: The dream I'm most excited to pursue with you is...
choices: Building a home and life together
Achieving goals that matter to us both

therapeutic.rationale: Shared dreams reveal what couples value most. Home-builders prioritize stability; adventure-seekers prioritize experience; family-growers prioritize connection; goal-achievers prioritize accomplishment. Aligning on dreams prevents future conflict.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different dreams aren't mutually exclusive. Most couples can pursue multiple types of shared dreams. Discuss priorities.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched dreams create clear shared direction and motivation.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What dream are you most excited to pursue together? Have you talked about it?

questions.text: When we discuss the future, I need us to...
choices: Stay flexible and open to change

therapeutic.rationale: Future planning styles vary. Big dreamers need inspiration; practical planners need feasibility; flexible types need adaptability; concrete planners need structure. Misaligned styles can create frustration in future discussions.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different planning styles need balance. The dreamer and the practical planner can check each other's tendencies. Find a middle ground.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched planning styles create smooth future discussions.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you like to plan for the future? Does your partner approach it differently?

questions.text: What gives me confidence in our future is...
choices: The way we communicate and connect
How committed we are to each other

therapeutic.rationale: Sources of future confidence reveal what couples trust most. Challenge-overcomers trust their resilience; value-sharers trust their alignment; communicators trust their connection; commitment-trusters trust their dedication. Knowing this strengthens confidence.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different confidence sources are all valid. Together, they provide multiple reasons to feel secure about your future.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared confidence sources reinforce what you both trust most about your relationship.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What gives you confidence in your future together? Have you told your partner?

questions.text: I believe our future will be shaped by...
choices: How we grow and evolve as people
The love and care we continue to show

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about what shapes the future reveal agency and priority. Choice-believers emphasize decisions; growth-believers emphasize development; commitment-believers emphasize dedication; love-believers emphasize connection. All perspectives are valuable.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these factors shape a couple's future. Your different emphases can complement each other.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared beliefs about what shapes your future create aligned approach to building it.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you believe will most shape your future together?
